Docs.param: The certificate to revoke.
The time the certificate was revoked, or to use the current system time. The default is .
The reason why the certificate was revoked, or to not include a reason. The default is .
Docs.summary: Adds the specified certificate to the revocation list with an optional revocation time and an optional revocation reason.
Docs.remarks: This method does not check that the certificate issuer is appropriate for the CRL that is being built, the certificate is just used for extracting the serial number.
Docs.exception: is not a supported revocation reason.

.method public hidebysig instance unsigned int8[] Build(class System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2 issuerCertificate, valuetype System.Numerics.BigInteger crlNumber, valuetype System.DateTimeOffset nextUpdate, valuetype System.Security.Cryptography.HashAlgorithmName hashAlgorithm, class System.Security.Cryptography.RSASignaturePadding rsaSignaturePadding, valuetype System.Nullable`1<valuetype System.DateTimeOffset> thisUpdate) cil managed

Public Function Build (issuerCertificate As X509Certificate2, crlNumber As BigInteger, nextUpdate As DateTimeOffset, hashAlgorithm As HashAlgorithmName, Optional rsaSignaturePadding As RSASignaturePadding = Nothing, Optional thisUpdate As Nullable(Of DateTimeOffset) = Nothing) As Byte()

member this.Build : System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2 * System.Numerics.BigInteger * DateTimeOffset * System.Security.Cryptography.HashAlgorithmName * System.Security.Cryptography.RSASignaturePadding * Nullable<DateTimeOffset> -> byte[]
MemberSignature.Usage: certificateRevocationListBuilder.Build (issuerCertificate, crlNumber, nextUpdate, hashAlgorithm, rsaSignaturePadding, thisUpdate)

Docs.param: The certificate representing the Certificate Authority (CA) that is creating this Certificate Revocation List.
The sequence number for this CRL. Per IETF RFC 5280, this value must always increase from one CRL to the next for a given CA.
The latest possible time before the CA will publish a newer CRL, generally treated as an expiration date for this CRL.
The hash algorithm to use when signing the CRL.

For Certificate Authorities with RSA keys, this parameter is required and specifies the RSA signature padding mode to use when signing the CRL. For all other algorithms, this parameter is ignored. The default is .
An optional value that specifies when this CRL was created, or to use the current system time. The default is .
Docs.summary: Builds a Certificate Revocation List (CRL) signed by the specified certificate.
Docs.returns: An array that contains the bytes of the signed CRL.
Docs.exception:
is .

has as the value of .

does not have an associated private key.
-or-
uses a public key algorithm that is unknown, or not supported by this implementation.
-or-
does not have a Basic Constraints extension.
-or-
has a Basic Constraints extension that indicates it is not a valid Certificate Authority certificate.
-or-
has a Key Usage extension that lacks the usage.
-or-
has an RSA private key but is .
-or-
has an unknown key algorithm.
-or-
is older than .
-or-
has the empty string as the value of .
-or-
was not recognized.

Public Function Build (issuerName As X500DistinguishedName, generator As X509SignatureGenerator, crlNumber As BigInteger, nextUpdate As DateTimeOffset, hashAlgorithm As HashAlgorithmName, authorityKeyIdentifier As X509AuthorityKeyIdentifierExtension, Optional thisUpdate As Nullable(Of DateTimeOffset) = Nothing) As Byte()

MemberSignature.Usage: certificateRevocationListBuilder.Build (issuerName, generator, crlNumber, nextUpdate, hashAlgorithm, authorityKeyIdentifier, thisUpdate)

Docs.param: The subject name of the certificate for the Certificate Authority (CA) that is issuing this CRL.
A signature generator to produce the CA signature for this CRL.
The sequence number for this CRL. Per IETF RFC 5280, this value must always increase from one CRL to the next for a given CA.
The latest possible time before the CA will publish a newer CRL, generally treated as an expiration date for this CRL.
The hash algorithm to use when signing the CRL.
The Authority Key Identifier to use in this CRL, identifying the CA certificate.
An optional value that specifies when this CRL was created, or to use the current system time. The default is .
Docs.returns: An array that contains the bytes of the signed CRL.
Docs.exception:
, , or is .
-or-
has as the value of .

is older than .
-or-
has the empty string as the value of .

to mark the extension as critical; otherwise, . The default is .
Docs.summary: Builds a CRL Distribution Point Extension with the specified retrieval URIs.
Docs.returns: An object suitable for use as a CRL Distribution Point Extension.
Docs.exception: One of the values in contains characters outside of the International Alphabet 5 (IA5) character space (which is equivalent to 7-bit US-ASCII).

Docs.param: The DER-encoded CRL to decode.
When this method returns, contains the CRL sequence number from the decoded CRL. This parameter is treated as uninitialized.
Docs.summary: Decodes the specified Certificate Revocation List (CRL) and produces a with all of the revocation entries from the decoded CRL.
Docs.returns: A new builder that has the same revocation entries as the decoded CRL.
Docs.exception:
could not be decoded.
-or-
decoded successfully, but decoding did not need all of the bytes provided in the array.

Docs.param: The PEM-encoded CRL to decode.
When this method returns, contains the CRL sequence number from the decoded CRL. This parameter is treated as uninitialized.
Docs.summary: Decodes the specified Certificate Revocation List (CRL) and produces a with all of the revocation entries from the decoded CRL.
Docs.returns: A new builder that has the same revocation entries as the decoded CRL.
Docs.remarks: This loads the first well-formed PEM found with an X509 CRL label.
Docs.exception:
did not contain a well-formed PEM payload with an X509 CRL label.
-or-
could not be decoded.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool RemoveEntry (byte[] serialNumber);
.method public hidebysig instance bool RemoveEntry(unsigned int8[] serialNumber) cil managed
Public Function RemoveEntry (serialNumber As Byte()) As Boolean
member this.RemoveEntry : byte[] -> bool
public: bool RemoveEntry(cli::array <System::Byte> ^ serialNumber);

Docs.param: The serial number to remove.
Docs.summary: Removes the specified serial number from the revocation list.
Docs.returns: if the serial number was found in the list and was removed; otherwise, .
Docs.remarks: This method assumes that the same serial number is not present on the list more than once, and thus stops at the first match.
